<gallery widths="300" heights="300">
File:HSD chronic02.png
</gallery>Injection-free CT scan showing a peri-cerebral collection in the left hemispheric convexity (arrows), mostly hypo-dense, in the shape of a "crescent moon" (concave medially and convex laterally): chronic subdural haematoma. Note the additional presence of a few spontaneously hyper-dense areas within the chronic subdural haematoma, indicating the presence of a recent rebleed.

question.question: What is the appearance of a chronic subdural hematoma on a CT scan?
question.option_a: A hyper-dense collection with a convex shape
question.option_b: A hypo-dense collection with a 'crescent moon' shape
question.option_c: A collection with mixed hyper- and hypo-dense areas and a convex shape
question.option_d: A collection with a 'crescent moon' shape and no hyper-dense areas
